III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Great Lakes Recovery Center for Youth is moving the program to a remodeled
former assisted living facility at 104 Malton Road Neqaunee, MI 49866. The
“new” facility is 15,568 square feet. The current plan is to use 8 of the former
efficiency apartments as bedrooms.
The measurements of the proposed resident bedrooms are as follows:
Room 132 278.83 square feet Possible 3 Resident Capacity
Room 133 271.83 square feet Possible 3 Resident Capacity
Room 136 273.00 square feet Possible 3 Resident Capacity
Room 137 304.00 square feet Possible 3 Resident Capacity
Room 155 316.88 square feet Possible 3 Resident Capacity
Room156 274.33 square feet Possible 3 Resident Capacity
Room159 274.33 square feet Possible 3 Resident Capacity
Room160 282.52 square feet Possible 3 Resident Capacity
The total licensed capacity is 20 residents. The initial plan is to set up the facility
for 16 residents, with an 8 bedroom male wing and an 8 bed female wing.
The building is in a square shape with an inner courtyard.
2

In the drawing above, the plan is to use eight bedrooms at the top of the drawing,
the left middle of the drawing will be the school area and the lower right will be
offices. The lower left will be reserved for future use.
The plan is to use eight bedrooms (4 on each wing) for residents. Each bedroom,
will have 2 residents per room, there is a 61 square foot bathroom with a shower
in each bedroom.
There a commercial type kitchen and a very large dining room.
The facility is large and has spacious common areas. In the two wings to be used
for bedrooms there are large common places and staff offices with a view of the
common area.
3

An environmental health inspection conducted on 09/22/2014 and a fire safety
inspection conducted on 09/23/2014 both resulted in an “A” rating.
B. Program Description
Shiloh Family North was formed in 1983, which was connected to Project Rehab
in Grand Rapids. Shiloh Family moved to Wright Street Marquette in 1984. Shiloh
Family North then left Project Rehab and became Great Lakes Recovery Centers
in 1993 and youth residential treatment facility changed its name from Shiloh to
Great Lakes Recovery Center for Youth.
Great Lakes Recovery Center for Youth is moving buildings, but the plan is to
continue the same program as on Wright St. in Marquette. The program is a
substance abuse treatment facility.
The facility will employ a cook who will plan menus and prepare meals and
snacks for residents. Pre-prepared meals will be made by the cook to be
warmed up by staff on the weekends when cook is off duty. Daily breakfast is
prepared by staff and residents.
Staffing ratio is 6:1 during waking hours. At night the staff to resident ratio would
be 8:1 ratio during sleeping hours.
Great Lakes Recovery Centers Youth Services Program provides a holistic
approach to residential substance abuse treatment. Adolescents between the
ages of 12-17 years old receive therapeutic services such as Individual Therapy,
Group Therapy, IEP/Educational Services and Coordination, Family Therapy,
Recreation, and Art Therapy. Clients are also actively involved in community
service projects, develop independent living skills, and are exposed to a variety
of evidence-based substance abuse and relapse-prevention services.
The facility provides residents with the skills necessary to maintain sobriety,
engage in healthy relationships, and increase their awareness of personal
responsibilities. In this setting, the residents also have the ability to continue
their education in an on-site school, participate in recreational activities, and are
introduced to the benefit of community service projects.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
Great Lakes Recovery Center for Youth is in full compliance with the Child
Caring Institution Rules that can be measured prior to the issuance of a new
license and has the stated intention of being in full compliance with the Child
Caring Institution Rules after the issuance of a provisional license.
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of an original provisional license to this child caring
institution, private.
